RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 47. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAPACHILL was off slowly and then bumped after the start, settled and was three wide on the turn, made a bid and split rivals off the turn, dropped to the inside and made a bid up the inside and edged away to prove best under a drive. CHUCK ADAMS vied for the early lead two wide, then tracked the leader two wide on the turn, came three wide into the lane and ran on willingly to the wire toi gain the place late. DARK DUTCHESS was off a step slow, went up to stalk the pace four wide, made a three wide bid on the turn to shake clear by the quarter pole, then faded late, bested rest. POLIE stalked the early pace three wide and came four wide into the drive and weakened. WARRIOR AT BAT vied for the lead on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior At Bat
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Dutchess
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, stalked 4 wide, bid 3 wide, clear, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Tapachill
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, 3 wide turn, split upper, shift in, bid, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Chuck Adams
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 2 wide, tracked 2 wide turn, came 3 wide, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Polie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since October 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since September 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claimin g Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STEELE MONEY was four wide into the first turn, rated along three wide, made a three wide move on the turn, then continued that move into the lane and edged clear late to prove best, driving. KAZ SWEET HEIST was reserved early on the inside, shifted out on the turn and advanced four wide, came five wide off the turn and closed well. FIELDSTONE stalked the pace three wide, then made a two wide bid on the turn to vie for command, then shook clear leaving the turn but was confronted by the winner nearing the furlong marker and was outfinished. BLUEBERRY MASH was settled early, made a four wide move on the turn but needed more late. MOON WARRIOR was taken back and dropped to the inside, then passed the tiring rivals. SYNONYM set a pressured pace on the inside and weakened in the drive. WONDER WATER pressed the pace two wide and weakened. MILLBANK MAN was through early. EL POLICIA chased the pace on the inside and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz Sweet Heist
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, came 5 wide upper stretch, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Synonym
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Millbank Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, through early,

ENTRY.NAME: El Policia
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Wonder Water
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Blueberry Mash
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide move, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Fieldstone
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Steele Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, rated 3 wide, bid 3 wide, edged clear, driving

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back inside, passed tiring rivals,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 15 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 15 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 15 Allo wed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUCK WILD was settled early, advanced five wide by the quarter pole, angled in nearing the furlong marker and closed to edged away late on the inside to prove best, driving. BEAST OR FAMINE prompted the early pace four wide, made a three wide bid on the turn to vie for command on the outside, then vied for the lead between rivals by the furlong marker but was out-kicked by the winner while staying on for the place award gamely. ACT OF VALOR was well rated early, made a four wide bid on the turn, continued that bid off the turn to loom boldly by the furlong marker but needed more late. AGAINST THE ODDS was settled early, made a five wide move off the turn and loomed boldly leaving the furlong marker but hung late. DIXIE CANNONBALL set a pressured pace on the inside, shook clear by the five sixteenths, but then was collared by the quarter pole, dug in gamely but faded late. MY BLUE EYES pressed the pace two wide early, between rivals by the quarter pole and weakened. HIGHWAY BOUND was well placed on the inside and then came up empty in the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Highway Bound
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, empty 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Cannonball
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: My Blue Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, between horses 1/4, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Beast Or Famine
ENTRY.OWNER: J A G Racing and Jettany Thoroughbred Corp.
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 4-3 wide, bid 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Against the Odds
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 5 wide, bid upper stretch, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Act of Valor
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated, bid 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Buck Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 5 wide 1/4 pole, angled in 1/8, closed, clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Lady Olivia at North Cliff Farm

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 15. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allow ed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BETWEEN DREAMS tracked the pace and made a three wide bid off the turn, then was roused left handed and drew clear to prove best. SHATTER ME was away alertly to set the early pace while clear, then was headed by the furlong marker and proved to be no match for that rival, clearly second best. PHANCY PHILLY chased the pace three wide, made a four wide bid off the turn but flattened out, bested rest. SEAMIALAUGH chased the pace two wide and had no rally. TERPEYE was off slowly and far back early, three wide by the quarter pole and was not a threat. KATY THE CAT was settled early on the inside and failed to respond. JACK'S LILLY tracked the pace on the inside and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Katy the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Seamialaugh
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 2 wide 1/4 pole, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Terpeye
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, far back early, 3 wide 1/4 pole, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Phancy Philly
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, bid 4 wide, flattened out, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Shatter Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set unchallenged pace, headed 1/8, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Jack's Lilly
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Between Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid 3 wide, roused 1/8, drew clear, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since October 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since September 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERFECT HIDEAWAY tracked the loose pacesetter throughout, was ridden along on the far turn and came two wide into the lane, continued to chase that rival to the furlong marker and then continued on and wore down that rival late to get up to prove best, driving. GOLDEN MOONLIGHT set a fast pace while clear, three wide into the lane and then shifted in by the furlong marker, got tired late and was caught. SWAN POINT was reserved early, made a three wide move on the turn and then finished willingly but needed more. FOXY JUNIOR was settled on the inside, saved ground on the turn but lacked the needed winning bid. CUENCA was off a step slow, then was motivated early and four wide into the first turn, had a three wide pursuit and tired. EIGHT DANZAS failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Eight Danzas
ENTRY.OWNER: Paladin of PA and Fox Tale Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Swan Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, 3 wide move turn, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Foxy Junior
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, needed stretch bid

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Hideaway
ENTRY.OWNER: McClay Thomas G Sweigart Dennis and Cullari Salvatore
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pacesetter, ridden turn, wore down rival, up late,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Moonlight
ENTRY.OWNER: Oh Happy Days Stable and River Card Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: set fast unchallenged pace, 3 wide into lane, tired late, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Cuenca
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, 4 wide first turn, 3 wide pursuit, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since October 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since September 15 All owed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CATALENA stalked the early pace, made a two wide bid on the turn to take over by the five sixteenths, then shook clear nearing the furlong marker and held well to prove best under a drive. IRISH SAMURAI was allowed to settle early on the inside, advanced on the inside and eased off the inside and made a four wide bid off the turn, ran on to the wire but could not get to the winner, second best. NADIABIZNIZ was four wide into the first turn, angled in and was reserved early, made a inside bid leaving the turn but flattened out late. DANCE STEP tracked the pace early, made a three wide bid on the turn to press the winner but weakened the final furlong. SHEA D SECRET was settled three wide and lacked a rally. ESTA CHUCK was four wide into the first turn, settled back and was not a factor. ANGELOFTHEGALAXY set the pace on the inside and gave way after five furlongs.

ENTRY.NAME: Catalena
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid 2 wide, shook clear, held well, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Samurai
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, bid 4 wide, gaining, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Dance Step
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid 3 wide turn, weakened 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Shea D Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle 3 wide, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Angelofthegalaxy
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, gave way after 5/8

ENTRY.NAME: Nadiabizniz
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, angled in, reserved inside, rail bid,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Esta Chuck
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, settled back, no factor,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 89. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 15. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since October 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDIAN BUZZ was well rated early, ranged up five wide leaving the quarter pole, then closed on the outside and got up late to prove best under left handed crop. FED CHAIR was three wide into the first turn, pressed the pace two wide, made a bid on the turn to gain a short lead, dug in gamely in the lane but was caught late to just miss. WARRIOR IN CHIEF was away alertly to cross over and set a pressured pace along the inside, then gave way grudgingly while saving the show award. SECRETARY AT WAR was well placed along the inside, eased out by the quarter pole and came three wide into the lane and between rivals buy hung in the lane, missed show award. C C'S WARRIOR tracked the early pace, made a four wide bid by the quarter pole and was between rivals off the turn but flattened out. POCOPSON STATION was taken back to trail on the inside and had no response.

ENTRY.NAME: Secretary At War
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, came 3 wide, between upoper, hung, missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: C C's Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid 4 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Pocopson Station
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back inside, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Fed Chair
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3 wide first turn, pressed 2 wide, bid 2 wide, dug in, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Indian Buzz
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated, ranged up 5 wide, bid, up late, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior in Chief
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pressured pace inside, held show
